subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Sufism: Islam's Spiritual Heart
description: A short lesson to help you apply Sufism: Islam's Spiritual Heart.

hook.text: While scholars debated law, Sufis danced. Mystical Islam seeks direct experience of God through love, not rules.

buildup.text: Sufism emerged in the 8th century as a reaction to Islam's growing legalism. Mystics sought inner spiritual truth.

discovery.text: Rumi, the world's best-selling poet, was a Sufi. His message: love is the path to God. Rules are just the doorway.

twist.text: Puritanical movements have attacked Sufism for centuries. Yet it survives because people crave spiritual experience.

climax.text: Sufism shows every religion has a mystical core. Beneath law and dogma, someone always seeks direct contact with God.

punchline.text: Sufis seek God through love, not law. Islam's mystical heart still beats.

quiz.question: What is Sufism?
options: Islam's mystical tradition focused on direct experience of God
